intro: Eutoca echioides, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its name is derived from the shape of its leaves, which resemble an arrowhead. Eutoca echioides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
